alert.note: Alert for Cortland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 3:43PM EST until February 20 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Binghamton NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Tioughnioga River At Cortland affecting Cortland County. For the Tioughnioga River Basin...including Cortland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tioughnioga River At Cortland. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Saturday night. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Flooding leads to some closures along Kellogg Road to the south of Cortland. This impact does not include any effects from ice jams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Friday morning to a crest of 8.7 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. This forecast does not include any effects from ice jams. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
